org.gbif.crawler.protocol.biocase

Class BiocaseResponseHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.crawler.protocol.AbstractResponseHandler
      • org.gbif.crawler.protocol.biocase.BiocaseResponseHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResponseHandler<org.apache.http.HttpResponse,List<Byte>>

    @NotThreadSafe
public class BiocaseResponseHandler
extends AbstractResponseHandler
    This class handles a BioCASe response.

    Every BioCASe response has a few pieces of optional diagnostic information:

    • recordCount is the number of records that are being returned in this response
    • recordDropped is the number of dropped records for this response, this number is not included in the recordCounts.
    • recordStart is the offset that was used for this request
    • totalSearchHits is the total number of results for this query. It usually doesn't return an exact count as that is expensive to calculate. If totalSearchHits is greater than recordCount + recordDropped + recordStart there should be more results

    As an example. Sending a request with start=0 and limit=100 could return a response like this: 

       <biocase:content recordCount='98' recordDropped='2' recordStart='0' totalSearchHits='101'>

    Which would mean that the response includes 98 records and 2 had to be dropped on the way out. Because totalSearchHits is greater than recordCount + recordDropped + recordStart there are more pages and the next request should be with start=100 and limit=100 which could return this: 

       <biocase:content recordCount='80' recordDropped='5' recordStart='100' totalSearchHits='185'>

    This class is not thread-safe.

      • shouldHash

        protected boolean shouldHash(org.codehaus.stax2.XMLStreamReader2 reader)
        Description copied from class: AbstractResponseHandler
        Needs to be implemented by subclasses to indicate to the parent class what the XML element is which delimits the actual content of a result. Everything inside this element including the element itself is hashed.

        shouldHash in class AbstractResponseHandler

        with the content element name

      • process

        protected void process(org.codehaus.stax2.XMLStreamReader2 reader)
                throws XMLStreamException,
                       ProtocolException
        Description copied from class: AbstractResponseHandler
        This needs to be implemented by subclasses to do actual processing on the XML data. This method is called for every single stream event (which includes whitespace etc.) so implementations need to check the event type and make sure to work on the correct elements.
        Specified by:
        process in class AbstractResponseHandler
        Parameters:
        reader - to use
        Throws:
        XMLStreamException - if there was an error with the XML parsing (e.g. invalid XML)
        ProtocolException - if there is a problem with the (well-formed) XML response (e.g. missing attribute)
